=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/06/12
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Guy Norman Bee', 'Sanford Bookstaver', 'James Whitmore Jr.', 'Seith Mann', 'Martha Mitchell', 'Jon Turteltaub', 'Matt Earl Beesley', 'Steven DePaul', 'Steve Gomer', 'Christine Moore'], 'Studio': ['CBS']}
Review Text: I was interested in the concept of surviving a nuclear disaster.  Unfortunately, it doesn't seem very true to life as far as the damaging effects would go, and somehow there is plenty of food for everyone to eat.  As the season moves on, it becomes more of a typical soap opera.  I lost interest about half-way through.
Review Title: Interesting concept
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------

Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
Gene Wilder  (Actor),     Jack Albertson  (Actor),     Mel Stuart  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Today's Deals, Spotlight Deals, Mother's Day Gift Ideas in Movies & TV
['Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory 40th Anniversary Edition (DVD)', 'Celebrate the 40th Anniversary of a musical fantasy for the young, and the young at heart. The mysterious candy maker extraordinaire Willy Wonka (Gene Wilder) hides a Golden Ticket inside five of his famous candy bars. The kids who find them are invited on a grand tour of the wondrous, wacky Wonka factory, and a chance for an even grander prize -- if they can resist temptation. The delightful musical score includes the hit song "The Candyman." From Roald Dahl\'s classic novel, produced by David Wolper ("Roots," "The Thorn Birds") and nominated for an Academy Award.', ']]>']

I like both versions of Willy Wonka because they each offer something a little different.  Both have basically the same great story.  Being a chocoholic myself, who wouldn't want to own a candy factory?
One of my favorite movies
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Zoltan Korda'], 'Producers': ['Alexander Korda'], 'Starring': ['John Clements', 'Ralph Richardson', 'C. Aubrey Smith'], 'Studio': ['The Criterion Collection']}
This is a great story of courage.  We will not always be understood by others.  It is most important that we understand ourselves.  In doing so, we will be better able to understand and love others.
One of my favorite movies

Although I don't like foul language at all, I am very offended by the cursing that references our Savior.  I didn't realize there was so much of it because it is edited out when watching these on network TV.  I so enjoy the action and comedy between the two characters.  Too bad it is ruined by the cursing.  I only got through Rush Hour, and that with great difficulty.
I miss the language editing for TV

profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user continues to enjoy films that explore family values, infused with humor and the intricacies of familial relationships. Their love for whimsical, musical fantasy films remains strong, creating nostalgia for both children and adults. They favor educational programming that is entertaining and imparts valuable lessons. Recently, they expressed disinterest in a series with a promising concept but criticized its departure into soap opera territory.

- **Humor Appreciation:** The user values light-hearted narratives rich with comedy and seeks entertainment that offers joy and thoughtful reflection. They maintain a high average rating of 4.8, indicating a penchant for films that evoke laughter and sentimentality, although their latest rating of 3.0 highlights a refined taste regarding content authenticity and depth.

- **Rating Behavior:** The user remains open to mature themes yet emphasizes sensitivity towards language use and negative portrayals, indicating a preference for nuanced content.

- **Content Sensitivity:** They appreciate films that handle humor carefully and avoid excessive negativity, reflecting a thoughtful viewing approach.

- **Language & Accessibility:** Prioritizing English-language films, the user values accessibility features such as audio descriptions and closed captions.

- **Director & Actor Affinity:** They maintain loyalty to particular directors and actors, showing appreciation for adaptations of classic literature and narratives that foster emotional depth, with a consistent admiration for engaging characters and intelligent dialogue. Their recent interactions reaffirm this affinity while introducing a refined critique of content quality.
